reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Divi Feb 1 through 10 in a timeshare studio unit. Right on the beach. Room 205. Divi is a resort chain in the Caribean and West Indies and this one happens to be situated on a bay called Little Bay just outside of Phillipsburg. Thus the name. Newly renovated. Full kitchen. Shop locally at the Grande Marshe in Phillipsburg to stock up on fruit, breakfast and lunch items. Air conditioning and ceiling fan. Nothing to complain about. Fresh towels and lots of them daily. Our check in was fine. Great place on the island . Central and close to all the action. Taxis are really cheap to get around, although we rented a car for a couple of days to tour the island. The car we rented was $35 a day. Drive on the right hand side , so same as home. Speed bumps everywhere so nobody speeds. No traffic lights. Few stop signs. Lots of traffic-circles. All drivers are very courtious. Easy to drive around on your own. Divi staff was friendly. Eugene at the Activities Desk was most helpful and honest. Lots of water sports right on site. Snorkeling to see pretty fish right in the Divi bay. Some saw fish on a small reef 20 feet off the Divi beach. Food in the Seaside Cafe was good and reasonably priced. Food in the Tuscon Restaurant was just ok. Eat there a night or two, but lots of choices in Phillipsburg.. a $6 taxi ride. Everything is American currency, and prices about the same as a U.S. city. There is even a McDonalds and Burger King in Philipsburg.
reviews.title: The Divi Little Bay was great
Stay away from Divi!!
reviews.text: There is a brand new Westin at Dawn Beach on the east side of the island. It is 5 star plus. A sign there invites you to join the Westin development at Dawn Beach in your own condo starting as low as $899,000 U.S. You get the idea. So, you can't rate Divi in that category, but we found the accomodation excellent. We are certainly recommending it to our friends back home and will return again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Returned 10Feb07. Can't beat the weather, but...you can beat Divi. Don't send anyone there, as all you'll get are complaints. The place is very old and in need of desperate repair. They need to stop renting the units and gut them (we saw their timeshare hotel beachfront model and it is what you expect, however, it is just a model)
reviews.title: The Hotel who doesn't Care
In need of serious attention
reviews.text: Room 2033, our first room had just a trickle of water and wasn't cleaned by 7 p.m. (the transfer took us all around the island and we were the last stop - 2 hour tour after a very long flight). The Divi is only 20 minutes from the airport. We went off to the restaurant to get something to eat (80 degrees in Canadian clothing and we still haven't had a shower)....we were then asked if we had reservations, otherwise it was outside with the smokers (no smoking inside). The host Walter kindly listened to our story and found a spot inside. That should have been our second clue they get a lot of complaints as he was experienced at make ‘em happy quick! Our first clue should have been during check-in, the staff was fielding calls and kept getting interrupted during check in and calming guests down!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room never did get cleaned, they washed the coffee pot and the ash tray in the bathroom sink without any dish soap and left the spilled coffee on the floor. The bathtub was falling apart and the caulking was purple with mould. Just deplorable. The screen door was broken, we called for repair, he came when we were out to dinner, tried to fix it with the lights on and filled the room with mosquitoes, the screen still didn't work. Next day the screen door was gone - hmmm...that solved the problem, just get rid of it. They told us the room had been thoroughly cleaned twice and should be okay...no it wasn't, the previous guests belongings were still under the bed (real thorough!)
reviews.title: Will Definitely Go Again

likes.liked: — Hard mattresses....back hurt for weeks afterwards. PS: Bring mosquito spray b/c they get into the rooms.

reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
reviews.text: This review is long overdue. My boyfriend and I stayed here last May. I had read previous reviews AFTER we had already booked a 5 day stay thru RCI. Some of the reviews were awful so I thought we made a terrible mistake. I did call in advance and tell them that some of the reviews were really bad and I was worried but they told me not to worry. We arrived. Check in was handled really well. We found our suite.....and OH MY GOD......it was gorgeous. HUGE rooms...clean....possibly recently renovated....right on the water and the views were to die for. Dinner that night at their on-site restaurant was really good too.

I can't say enough good things about our experience here. WE loved the resort location.....we walked the hilly walk to and from Phillipsburg a few times.....had drinks at a resort up/down the hill. A car rental really helps. We travelled everywhere! Marigot twice....into Phillisburg one night to gamble....to pretty much every beach we could find or that was recommended. Some days....two a day. We only had 4 days so we crammed alot in. The food everywhere (lunch & dinner) was fantastic. We both love to cook so we're critical.....I am not kidding...I only had one bad meal and unfortunately that was an overcooked grilled lobster....I just about cried....but I still ate it. The sunset from the restaurant deck made up for it.
reviews.title: Had a great time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We met the nicest people....many wonderful transplanted Euros and natives....We met an Island icon....Roland Richardson a very talented artist at the security gates of a resort that we didn't know was VERY private. He happened to be driving by and overheard the guard telling us to go away. He gratiously invited us in (we had no idea who he was until we got in his gallery. Oddly, just that morning I was saying I wanted to see if we could find his gallery...(I'm an artist too so I noticed his work in the airplane travel guide...) He and his lovely wife gave us a tour of his Gallery at the LaSamanna Resort and then he gave us a tour of the resort. It was all just so surreal. We went to Marigot our last day to see his gallery there and to say thank you again. He was one of many "travel angels" that we met while there. Try to see his gallery in Marigot. His work is fantastic and Marigot is a must see town.
reviews.title: Good stay had little to do with the hotel

likes.disliked: — A little run down and bad linens

reviews.title: Matrix
reviews.text: So.....we loved the Divi Little Bay. The little bay we were on was private enough for us in front of our suite. Every morning I was the only one out walking the entire stretch....(there are two sections to the resort), one an older hotel-type and the other....newer condo-type 3 story. You can walk out your room and snorkel or kayak good distances and there's tons of great shells. Placid water.. Great views. .. We drove to other beaches the days they let the cruise ships use the beach at the bigger part of the cove so I can't say if it was obnoxious or not. You might want to plan excursions on those days.
Maybe ask for a new or renovated room if you are concerned with room amenities or condition. The timeshare section was just fabulous tho....or at least our suite was.
reviews.title: Loved our time in Divi Little Bay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've been staying at Divi Little Bay since 2001, and must say that the resort has dramatically improved each year. Our very large 2-bedroom suite was just renovated, with a king-size bed, two seating areas, two bathrooms (one with jacuzzi tub), full kitchen, full laundry, two large televisions, and both rooms had private decks with amazing views. Visitors MUST walk the grounds and discover the intimate infinity pool, Fort Amsterdam, gorgeous sunset views, and the entertaining parrots throughout the property. The beaches are immaculate, as is the main pool, with new lounge chairs and a lovely outdoor cafe/bar. The restaurant, though minimally decorated, had excellent food which was reasonably priced. The staff was very accomodating, and the service prompt. I definitely recommend this resort, particularly the suites, for any discerning beach lovers!
reviews.title: Amazing views, great resort

likes.liked: — Modern, clean, spacious and great balcon views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently returned from our first trip to Sint Maarten. Like many other people we were very hesitant about staying at Divi Little Bay. The resort has the potential to be an outstanding resort -- neglect from previous management has left the resort in need of repairs. However, we were extremely fortunate. Our room was absolutely fabulous; 1 bedroom casita that was recently redone. In fact we were only the second people to stay the newly remodeled 1 bedrooms. During check in I told the front desk attendent that I was a little concerned about our room and they told security to take us to the room to see if we wanted it. We opened the door and saw a nice living room with a high-def flat screen TV, small kitchen with cherry cabinets, king bed with 42 inch high def flat screen. Needless to say we took the room and couldn't have been happier. The view from the porch allowed me to look at the ocean while enjoying the morning coffee. If you need ideas for things to do, go see Eugene (she is in charge of helping you plan your activities off of the property). She is great and her suggestions are spot on. The spa at Divi is great. My wife and I enjoyed a massage the first morning we were there and it was a great experience. The following day my wife had a pedicure and commented it was one of the best she had ever received. The food at Divi is okay. We always enjoyed having lunch at the Seabreeze pool. Food was good and the wait staff really enjoyed their job. Breakfast and dinner are at Toucan's. The staff and the food was just okay. We only had breakfast once and it was pretty good. Dinner on the other hand left something to be desired; my advice is to enjoy dinner at one of the local establishments because the food and service our great. We used the taxi for the first 6 days then grew familiar enough to rent a jeep for the last three days. The taxi drivers were really enjoyable to speak with and never tried to rip you off. Two rules to pay attention to: always negotiate the price prior to getting in and only use taxi's that have taxi xxx on their license plate. Using other cabs isn't advised (that's what we were told). Divi provides a 3 hour island tour and I would highly recommend it. It allowed us to become familiar with the island along with areas to be careful in. We rented a car from Thrifty on property and I really felt uncomfortable. The individual went really fast and the car we received was a piece of junk. Needless to say we only had a one day rental. Later in the week we used Original Car Rental and the experience was great. Dorsette is great and is extremely helpful. The next time we go there we will schedule our rental car ahead of time and will pick it up at the airport. Price for jeeps will run $65 a day and an extra $12 for insurance. The beaches are beautiful and there isn't enough time in the day to enjoy all of them. Divi is undergoing major restoration; we were told restoration will be complete in 2008. All in all, Divi is a very nice resort.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

likes.disliked: — Bar and Restaraunt Manager-- lack customer service skills

reviews.text: After confirming all my reservations prior to leaving, I arrive at the Divi late at night to find they do not have my reservation! Although they did give me a room for the night and I did have to check out and get a new room the next day, they were pretty accomidating with all things considered. I am not completely sure this was their fault or Orbitz, but someone went wrong somewhere. The first night in my room, I awoke with over 8 mosiquito bites on my face, chest and arms! The meals at the resort were just ok and the service was the same. We took the advice from other Trip Advisor reviews and went to the end of the Divi to the other small resort and ate at the Gingerbread Cafe. Great food, espically breakfast. The resort was under construction, rarely did the room keys work with the first 3 - 5 tries. Buckets and brooms were left in the room by the maid the entire stay, and some days we would get 2 towels, other days sometimes more towels, but no wash cloths. We requested extra pillows 2 different times in 1 day and when they finally came, the one pillow smelled terribly of cat urine. The activities were ok...the managers party had next to no food for the amount of people attended as well as ran out of beer within the first 1/2 hour of the 2 hour gathering. I can go on and on...but as my title says lots of little things begin to add up. Last but certainly not least...the rental car. If no one gets anything from this review other than what I am about to say and show you in the pictures, I will be happy and can believe that I have saved a few lives. DO NOT, I repeat DO NOT rent a car from Thrifty. Although you might think it is convient because there is a Thrifty right on Divi's property, take my advice and don't. After driving the rental for 3 days we find ourselves stranded on the French side of the island with our tire hanging on the car by the hubcap. Unable to pull off the road completly and beg 2 locals to help us, we realize the car they rented to 2 twenty-something girls (one who is pregnant) had the front rim completely rusted and eroded away to the point where not a single lug nut was keeping the tire on the car! Needless to say after paying people to change the tire and paying more locals to put air in the flat spare we counted our blessing the entire drive back to the resort. After being relieved of making it back alive, we get blamed for causing the damage and are told we are responsible by the Thrifty rep. I didn't know rust can occur in 3 days time! After lots of arguring and getting nowhere...Divi Gen. Mngr. stepped in and was very helpful with the situation, but now being home, things are still not resolved with the charges I incurred from Thrifty. After checking out and being charged for the entire stay when I paid through Orbitz ahead of time was another hassle to get resolved but did quickly once the mngr came in for the day. Friends of mine were charged $156 internet fee, which didn't apply to them being neither had a pc and then was deducted once something was said. So, be safe, be smart and take it all with a grain of margarita salt!
reviews.title: Lots of little things begin to add up... (look at the pics!)

reviews.text: We, two couples, enjoyed our stay. Rooms were average, but barely saw them. The resort is pretty, especially the view from our one-bedroom suites. All staff were accomodating and very friendly. Recognized us by the second day making our stay even more enjoyable. They were renovating the grounds and rooms while we were there, but no disruption to guests. Pool was fun, but never crowded.
